meanings.definition: Overbalance or become unsteady and fall.
meanings.sent1: The tower started to topple as the wind blew harder.
meanings.sent2: I watched the vase topple off the shelf and shatter on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy clown made the audience laugh as he pretended to topple over.
meanings.sent4: Her world seemed to topple when she received the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The dominoes lined up perfectly, ready to topple at the slightest touch.

meanings.sent1: The strong wind can easily topple a tree in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers had to carefully plan how to topple the old building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to topple the stack of books on the table.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a powerful gust of wind, ready to topple her resolve.
meanings.sent5: The giant statue was rigged to topple during the grand finale of the show.

meanings.sent1: The citizens united to topple the corrupt government.
meanings.sent2: The rebels' plan was to topple the dictator and establish a new regime.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected scandal threatened to topple the CEO from his position of authority.
meanings.sent4: The whistleblower's evidence was the final push needed to topple the corrupt organization.
meanings.sent5: The young hero's goal was to topple the evil king and bring peace to the kingdom.
